title: Jungling Guide
body:
Hi, I often play junglers........ and lately I don't want to offend the jungling community but lately in games I have noticed jungling done incorrectly....... First

Determine the best time to lay your first gank..............
For many champs like lee sin its around early game......... Don't wait for level 6........

Why should I gank at lvl 2 or 4 or 3 or why should I gank in the early game?

We have a term called snowball, lane pressure, and lane security...........
Let me define these terms for you.

Snowball lane........= When you gank a lane and cause a rippling effect across the lane, forcing the other team to lose income, die, or in some way fall below the laner.


Lane pressure = Just means to have a presence in a lane to help out laners

Lane security = Being in the right place at the right time when the other Jungler is in that lane about to gank

Sometimes these things may need you to use wards, buying a warding item or just being more Map aware and using the best gank routes possible............................... Fishing out enemy wards will help you to stay unseen.
Sneaky ganks are good ganks......................

Ganking at an early stage is important but remember the role you play to your team, early game early damage, late game later tank or support role, a jungler will never play a hyper carry role unless super fed, if you become super fed as a jungler, you have the option to become more of a carry but if the game goes into late stages remember your role Like lee sin I would start tanking up, warwick, jarvan, etc because it will take a 5v5 effort to finish the game..

Runes and masteries are very important, make sure you are using the correct runes and masteries to suit the champion, I love changing it up but at the same time, no point having an extra defensive rune if your looking to pressure early
